name: ft991a-control
displayName: FT-991A Control - Ham Radio MCP Server
description: AI-controllable Yaesu FT-991A transceiver interface with comprehensive CAT control. Features frequency/mode control, power management, S-meter reading, PTT keying, band switching, and full radio status monitoring via MCP tools.

tools.name: get_frequency
tools.description: Get the current VFO-A frequency in Hz from the FT-991A transceiver

tools.name: set_frequency
tools.description: Tune the FT-991A to a specific frequency in Hz (30kHz - 56MHz range)

tools.name: get_mode
tools.description: Get the current operating mode (LSB, USB, CW, FM, AM, DATA-USB for FT8, etc.)

tools.name: set_mode
tools.description: Change the operating mode (LSB/USB/CW/FM/AM/DATA_USB for digital modes)

tools.name: get_smeter
tools.description: Read the S-meter signal strength measurement from the receiver

tools.name: get_power
tools.description: Get the current TX power setting in watts

tools.name: set_power
tools.description: Set the TX power output (5-100W range for FT-991A)

tools.name: ptt_on
tools.description: Key the transmitter (start transmitting) - use with caution

tools.name: ptt_off
tools.description: Unkey the transmitter (return to receive mode)

tools.name: get_status
tools.description: Get complete radio status including frequency, mode, S-meter, TX/RX state, and power

tools.name: set_band
tools.description: Switch to a specific amateur radio band (160M, 80M, 40M, 20M, etc.)

tools.name: get_memories
tools.description: List all programmed memory channels with frequencies and modes

tools.name: recall_memory
tools.description: Tune to a specific memory channel (1-99)

tools.name: toggle_tx_lock
tools.description: Toggle TX lockout to prevent accidental transmission (safety feature)

configuration.description: Requires FT-991A connected via USB serial port. Default: /dev/ttyUSB0 @ 38400 baud. Radio menu item 031 must match baud rate.

parameters.name: baud
parameters.description: Serial baud rate (must match radio menu 031)

hardware: USB-A to USB-B cable (for CAT control)
Linux system with USB serial support
setup: Enable CAT control on FT-991A (menu item 031)
Connect USB cable between radio and computer
Ensure user has access to serial port (/dev/ttyUSB0)

features: Frequency control across entire FT-991A range (30kHz-56MHz)

warnings: PTT control can key the transmitter - ensure proper antenna connection
Verify license privileges before transmitting on any frequency
High power output (100W) - ensure adequate cooling and SWR
RF exposure limits must be observed per FCC/IC regulations
features: TX lockout toggle for accidental transmission prevention
